entity.description: director of research and training at Bellingcat

entity.full_classification: Entity > MaterialEntity > PhysicalAsset > Vehicle > Aircraft > Plane

entity.description: armed group controlling eastern Ukraine territory

aspect.verbatim: Bellingcat is transforming investigative journalism with open-sourced information
aspect.normalized: Bellingcat transforms investigative journalism by using open-sourced information

attribute.value: transforms investigative journalism via open-source information

actuality.verbatim: The independent news collective is teaching a new generation of journalists and citizens to spot the stories in plain sight.
actuality.normalized: The independent news collective teaches a new generation of journalists and citizens to spot the stories in plain sight.
actuality.outcome: journalists and citizens learn to spot stories

actuality.verbatim: Bellingcat has used open sources, such as satellite maps and social media posts, to unmask Russian spies and solve mysterious plane crashes.
actuality.normalized: Bellingcat uses open sources such as satellite maps and social media posts to unmask Russian spies and solve mysterious plane crashes.
actuality.outcome: Russian spies unmasked, plane crashes solved

actuality.verbatim: On July 17, 2014, Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17) was shot down over eastern Ukraine.
actuality.normalized: On July 17, 2014, Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17) is shot down over eastern Ukraine.

actuality.verbatim: Later that year, an investigative team put out a report linking the pro-Russian separatists to the Buk-M1 missile launcher likely responsible for the tragedy.
actuality.normalized: Later that year, an investigative team publishes a report that links the pro-Russian separatists to the Buk-M1 missile launcher likely responsible for the tragedy.
actuality.outcome: report links separatists to missile launcher

actuality.verbatim: Its authors were a small, independent collective of researchers and citizen journalists called Bellingcat, and their information came from social media posts, Google Maps satellite imagery, and videos uploaded to YouTube.
actuality.normalized: Its authors are a small, independent collective of researchers and citizen journalists called Bellingcat, and their information comes from social media posts, Google Maps satellite imagery, and videos uploaded to YouTube.
actuality.outcome: Bellingcat authors report using open sources

actuality.verbatim: Bellingcat was founded by Eliot Higgins, a citizen journalist who gained online prominence investigating weapons smuggling during the Syrian war.
actuality.normalized: Eliot Higgins, a citizen journalist, founds Bellingcat after he gains online prominence by investigating weapons smuggling during the Syrian war.

actuality.verbatim: Since then, Bellingcat has legally registered as a foundation in the Netherlands and has continued to unearth consequential details to some of the most important news stories of the last decade, including the Syrian War, the Christchurch mosque massacre, and the poisonings of Yulia Skripal and Alexei Navalny.
actuality.normalized: Since then, Bellingcat legally registers as a foundation in the Netherlands and continues to unearth consequential details for major news stories.

aspect.verbatim: The foundation’s model of journalism is known as “open-source investigation.”
aspect.normalized: The foundation’s model of journalism is known as “open-source investigation.”

actuality.verbatim: In its investigation into the shooting of Ashli Babbitt, researchers created a timeline of radicalization through her social-media footprint; they also mapped her journey during the Capitol Riot by locating videos showing her in the crowd and comparing background details to publicly available floorplans of the U.S. Capitol Building.
actuality.normalized: In its investigation into the shooting of Ashli Babbitt, researchers create a timeline of radicalization through her social-media footprint and map her journey during the Capitol Riot.

actuality.verbatim: Bellingcat has also gone to great lengths to archive and back up important data before they are lost.
actuality.normalized: Bellingcat goes to great lengths to archive and back up important data before they are lost.

actuality.verbatim: While today Bellingcat employs a small team of journalists and editors, it still relies on volunteers and citizen journalists willing to dedicate the time and effort to scrape the internet for leads.
actuality.normalized: While today Bellingcat employs a small team of journalists and editors, it still relies on volunteers and citizen journalists who dedicate time and effort to scrape the internet for leads.

actuality.verbatim: It also offers training workshops to teach open-source investigation.
actuality.normalized: It also offers training workshops to teach open-source investigation.

actuality.verbatim: The foundation has worked with several news partners to investigate stories and promote its work, such as sharing the findings of its Riley June Williams investigation with NBC.
actuality.normalized: The foundation works with several news partners to investigate stories and promote its work, such as sharing the findings of its Riley June Williams investigation with NBC.

actuality.verbatim: As Toler told us: “Journalism doesn’t work one way or the other. It should be both. Do some open-source sleuthing to complement and boost your on-the-ground reporting.”
actuality.normalized: Toler says journalism should combine open-source sleuthing with on-the-ground reporting.
